fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Rank data within a JSON or CSV import file is not processed by the JSON or CSV importer. This means the the ranking from a source site cannot be moved into another using using the JSON or CSV importer.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- On a site, re-arrange the project issues in the backlog page
- Generate a CSV / JSON file from the project with the *Rank* field included 
- On another site, import the CSV file while mapping the Rank field or import the JSON file 

h3. Expected Results

The imported jira issues preserves the ranking on the board. 

h3. Actual Results

No error is returned and no ranking data is imported or used. The imported issues are arranged on the board based on their create time. 

Note : JRACLOUD-67857 workaround will only create *new* rank data for the imported issue. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: External system import is not able to use Rank data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a system with a custom and system field with the same name, the CSV importer always chooses the custom field as the target. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 |Create a custom field called *Resolution* (select list) | |
 | Perform a CSV import | |
 | Map a column to the *Issue fields - Resolution* |  !resolution.png|thumbnail! |
 | Hit Next | |
 
h3. Expected Results

The column should map the system issue field. Import should populate the system field. 

h3. Actual Results

Mapping generated is with the custom field. 

 !custom field.png|thumbnail! 

The data will also be imported to the custom field. 

h3. Workaround

Use a configuration file for the CSV import and map the column to the correct system field. 

{code}
    "Resolution" : {
      "jira.field" : "resolution",
      "userChanged" : "true",
      "manualMapping" : "true"
    }
{code}
fields.summary: CSV importer unable to handle custom and system field with the same name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to import the XML backups with "Import attachments" button, it will show:
{quote}
*Jira attachments import is complete*
Your attachments import is complete. You can now use Jira as normal.
{quote}

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* Attachments importer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a backup file with only XML files
# Go to *System > Restore system*
# Click on *Import attachments*
# Choose the backup file > *Proceed*

h3. Expected Results
An error message will be prompted to tell the wrong structure of the file.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens in the backend. Successful message prompted.
{quote}
*Jira attachments import is complete*
Your attachments import is complete. You can now use Jira as normal.
{quote}

h3. Notes
* *Import attachments" functionality should show an error message whenever an XML file detected (same for a full backup file that contains both XMLs and attachments)
fields.summary: Importing XML backup with "Import Attachments" Functionality Doesn't Show Any Error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing an import from the bulk creation CSV import (on the create issue screen) and set the value for a Task and its sub-tasks on the CSV file, the import troughs an error about {{Subtask 'test CSV' doesn't have a valid Parent Id selection. Issue will not be created}}. 

We got this same error in these scenarios:
# Setting an issue Id and parent Id arbitrary and the CSV file;
# Using an issue Id from an already created task in the project

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a CSV file with the Issue Id and Parent Id column;
 # Use the non-admin CSV import (create issue screen > Import issue button);
 # Mapp the columns of issue Id and parent Id
 # Begin the CSV import

h3. Expected Results

The import should create the Task and the Sub-task accordingly as in the CSV file.

h3. Actual Results

The import stops with the following error:
{code} 
Subtask 'test CSV' doesn't have a valid Parent Id selection. Issue will not be created
{code}

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

A workaround will be run the CSV import through the *External system import*, accessible only by Jira administrators
fields.summary: The non-admin CSV Importer gives an error for the parent Id field
Having a custom field called "Priority" won't allow perform a CSV import for the system field "Priority"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you move a next gen project to to the Trash and then attempt to generate a backup for server the backup manager does not display the trashed project in the list of next gen projects but the backup for server button is still disabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next gen project
 # Move it to the Trash
 # Visit the Backup Manager Page
 # Note the projects absence from the next gen project list
 # Attempt to generate a backup for server
 # You can't, the button is disabled

h3. Expected Results

Either the backup should exclude trashed next gen projects or otherwise at least display them in the next gen project list. Also, clicking the 'Delete all next gen projects' does not remove next gen projects in the trash.
h3. Actual Results

You can't generate a backup until the trashed Next-Gen project is permanently deleted from the trash.
h3. Workaround

Delete the next gen project(s) from *Jira Settings* -> *Projects* -> *Trash*
fields.summary: Next-Gen Projects in Trash Prevent Backup For Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43223].

h3. Summary

When migrating from Cloud to Server, the directory poller job is not removed for the previous Crowd User Directory (aka Horde).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Export from a JIRA Cloud instance.
# Import it into JIRA Server.

h3. Expected Results

There are no noticeable errors.

h3. Actual Results

The following exception is thrown:

{noformat}
2015-05-04 10:45:36,829 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 ERROR      [com.atlassian.scheduler.JobRunnerResponse] Unable to synchronise directory
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.DirectoryNotFoundException: Directory <10000> does not exist
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.JiraDirectorySynchroniser.runJob(JiraDirectorySynchroniser.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.quartz1.Quartz1Job.execute(Quartz1Job.java:32)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:223)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:549)
{noformat}

Additionally viewing the Scheduler Administration page will present errors as per the attached screenshot.

h3. Workaround

You can remove the orphaned job directly from the database as per our [Directory Sync Throws Error "Directory <2> does not exist"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Directory+Sync+Throws+Error+Directory+%3C2%3E+does+not+exist] KB article.

h3. Notes

When this is fixed, please include an upgrade task to clean up existing records, or some provide some SQL as a workaround that can be used to fix the problem.
fields.summary: Exporting from JIRA Cloud does not remove Directory Synchronisation Job resulting in Directory does not exist errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Large CSV exports can fail due to a timeout

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a JQL query which yields a large number of results (900~1000 issues). This also occurs with complex JQL or searches with too many fields.
# Try to export these results to a CSV file.

h3. Expected Results
The file is generated successfully.

h3. Actual Results
It took some time to get a response and eventually you get a 504 (Gateway timeout) error.
 
h3. Notes
- The problem is intermittent.

h3.Workaround
- Split the CSV file into smaller batches, as exporting to the limit of 1000 issues may cause the timeout.
[Export More than 1000 Issues to Excel from Issue Navigator in JIRA Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/export-more-than-1000-issues-to-excel-from-issue-navigator-in-jira-cloud-779160811.html]
- Use REST API to get the results. JSON does not cause a timeout.
[Jira REST API reference|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-search-get]
fields.summary: Large CSV exports can fail due to a timeout

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
After an import from a cloud backup, Jira Issues in Server show AAIDs in comments instead of usernames. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Cloud site with the new wiki user mentions enabled. 
# Access a ticket
# Change to the old issue view
# Add a new comment and mention another user. 
# You will see the AAID of the user in the markup
# Create a backup for Server 
# Import this backup to Jira Server 

h3. Expected Results
# The backup is imported successfully and Jira Server can correctly render the data. 

h3. Actual Results
# Jira Server cannot understand the markup with AAIDs 

h3. Workaround
Any comments in the new issue view continue to work fine when imported in Server. 
If possible re-add the comments on the tickets in the new issue view and then import to Server.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud to Server migrations not working with the new Wiki User Mentions.

fields.description:
h2. Summary
After generating a backup in JIRA Cloud, if the backup file is huge and takes longer than *10 minutes*, the download *might* fail randomly.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Generate a backup in Cloud.
# Download the backup file

h2. Expected Result
The download should proceed until it finishes.

h2. Current Result
The download will end randomly and the backup file size is not downloaded fully.

The download dies before completing. Sometimes it looks like it finished successfully as it doesn't through an error in the browser while downloading but the download file isn't complete.
fields.summary: Downloads are failing for very large backups for customers

fields.summary: Provide jira worklogs mappings in App migration platform

fields.description:
When the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant migrates configuration data from server to cloud it omits (or leaves behind) non-standard custom field types.

Here's the list of standard custom field types that are automatically migrated with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant:

||Custom Field Type||
|Text Field (single line)|
|Date Picker|
|Number Field|
|Date Time Picker|
|Labels|
|Select List (single choice)|
|Checkbox|
|User Picker (single / multiple)|
|Group|
|User picker (single)|
|User picker (multiple)|
|Multi-line text|
|Environment|
|Radio button|

Customers with apps that add custom fields using non-standard custom field types will need to install apps that are 'needed in cloud' and manually recreate their custom field configurations. 

Example of potentially affected apps (list may not be comprehensive):
||App name||Marketplace Partner name||Current migration path instructions (manual)||
|Tempo Timesheets - Time Tracking & Reporting|Tempo for Jira|[Read more|https://tempo-io.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/THC/pages/1372127383/Tempo+Server+Migration+Guide]|

We are adding capabilities to the Cloud Migrations Assistants to migrate app data automatically. This functionality requires Marketplace Partners to build automated migration paths compatible with the Cloud Migration Assistants; they can do so using the [App migration platform|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/about/]. The App migration platform does not support apps migrating their own non-standard custom fields.
fields.summary: Automatically migrate non-standard custom fields with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
We are adding capabilities to the Cloud Migrations Assistants to migrate app data automatically. This functionality requires Marketplace Partners to build automated migration paths compatible with the Cloud Migration Assistants; they can do so using the [App migration platform|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/about/].

Apps that store JQL may be storing JQL containing user references that will not work correctly in cloud. These user references will need to be converted from the format used in server (username / user key) to the format used in cloud (AAID) during the migration.
fields.summary: Create an API to convert user references stored in JQL to AAID during the migration

fields.description:
The Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant presents warnings to customers before a migration begins to allow customers to correct any issues that may impact the success of a migration.

We are adding capabilities to the Cloud Migrations Assistants to migrate app data automatically. This functionality requires Marketplace Partners to build automated migration paths compatible with the Cloud Migration Assistants; they can do so using the [App migration platform|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/about/].

Apps that migrate automatically with the cloud migration assistant may have similar checks and warnings to present to customers. The Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant does not support custom pre-flight check messages created by apps.
fields.summary: Create an extension point in the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant for apps to add custom pre-flight check messaging

fields.description:
When the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant migrates workflow configurations from server to cloud, remote workflow extensions (that is any post functions, conditions, or validators created by an app) is removed from the configuration during the migration. This is to prevent the workflow from not working in Cloud (post migration) if the app is not installed. 

Customers with apps that add remote workflow extensions will need to install apps that are 'needed in cloud' and manually recreate their workflow configurations to add post functions, conditions, and validators created by apps. 

Example of affected apps (list may not be comprehensive):

||App Name||Marketplace Partner Name||Current migration path instructions (manual)||
|Create on Transition for Jira|Bob Swift Atlassian Apps (an Appfire company)|[Read more|https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CSOT/pages/1210286295/Migration+from+server+DC+to+cloud]|
|Jira Misc Workflow Extensions (JMWE)|Innovalog Atlassian Apps (an Appfire company)|[Read more|https://innovalog.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/JMWEC/pages/156172382/Migrating+from+JIRA+Server+to+JIRA+Cloud]|
|JSU Automation Suite for Jira Workflows|Beecom Atlassian Apps (an Appfire company)|[Read more|https://beecom-products.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/JSU/pages/265715713/Migrating+from+Jira+Server+to+Jira+Cloud]|
|ScriptRunner for Jira| Adaptavist|[Read more|https://scriptrunner-docs.connect.adaptavist.com/jiracloud/migrating.html#_migrating_from_scriptrunner_for_jira_server_to_cloud]|
|Update on Transition for Jira| Bob Swift Atlassian Apps (an Appfire company)|[Read more|https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CW/pages/1399914939/Cloud+support+for+Update+on+Transition+for+Jira]|
|Xporter - Export issues from Jira| Xpand IT|[Read more|https://confluence.xpand-it.com/display/public/XPORTER/Server+to+Cloud+Migration]|

We are adding capabilities to the Cloud Migrations Assistants to migrate app data automatically. This functionality requires Marketplace Partners to build automated migration paths compatible with the Cloud Migration Assistants; they can do so using the [App migration platform|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/about/]. The App migration platform does not support apps migrating their own remote workflow extensions.
fields.summary: Automatically migrate remote workflow extensions (Post Functions, Conditions, Validators created by apps) with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
During Confluence startup, the [Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant-973486571.html] pre-loads statistics about all Confluence Spaces.

If the number of Spaces is too high, there will be warning entries in the application logs similar to the below.
{code}
2020-11-23 18:03:55,574 WARN [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [hibernate.query.internal.QueryParameterBindingsImpl] doLogf HHH000443: Dialect [org.hibernate.dialect.SQLServer2012Dialect] limits the number of elements in an IN predicate to 2100 entries.  However, the given parameter list [keys] contained 11000 entries, which will likely cause failures to execute the query in the database
2020-11-23 18:03:55,790 ERROR [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [engine.jdbc.spi.SqlExceptionHelper] doLog The incoming request has too many parameters. The server supports a maximum of 2100 parameters. Reduce the number of parameters and resend the request.
{code}



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla instance of Confluence using SQL Server.
# Create thousands of Spaces; i.e. 10000
# Start Confluence.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence starts with no warning presented by the Cloud Migration Assistant.

h3. Actual Results
The below warning appears in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}}:
{code}
2020-11-23 18:03:55,574 WARN [SiteSummaryCalculator:thread-1] [hibernate.query.internal.QueryParameterBindingsImpl] doLogf HHH000443: Dialect [org.hibernate.dialect.SQLServer2012Dialect] limits the number of elements in an IN predicate to 2100 entries.  However, the given parameter list [keys] contained 11000 entries, which will likely cause failures to execute the query in the database

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When syncing users and group using one of the migration tools, if a user is found with a duplicate email or missing email at all, the tool will present a list with all the users in those conditions, asking the user to adjust those emails, in some cases, it's necessary to change the emails in the external directory (Crowd, LDAP, AD, etc).

h3. Actual Results

The tools will provide a list of the users to be fixed and the changes that need to be made and attempt to sync the users and groups again.

h3. Expected Results

It would be nice if the tool would allow the users to adjust or exclude accounts that are not meant to be migrated like service accounts, etc, without needing to edit their emails in the source, if there were options to adjust these emails within the app it would avoid problems when trying to sync the user/groups.
fields.summary: Improve users and groups sync when using migration tooling

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you have a plan migrating thousands of spaces when viewing the detail spaces page, all the spaces are loaded on the same page, so it's difficult to scroll down to check the spaces migration progress, adding a pagination 

h3. Expected Results

The page would load fast and you would be able to easily navigate.

h3. Actual Results

Not only the page takes a while to load, but it's also difficult to navigate since the browser gets a bit unresponsive with the number of objects being loaded in the interface.
fields.summary: [CCMA] Paginate the view details page in the space migration

fields.description:
Apps whose backend services are shared across multiple apps could use cloudAppKey in webhook headers to make their app data migration services also a shared service. Today, cloudAppKey is included in the webhook payload but not in the webhook header. 

Workaround would be to make webhooks app specific.
fields.summary: Add cloudAppKey to webhook headers
